column1: Enable prescription lens configurator for this product
column2: Enable prescription lens configurator for this product

column1: Configure your prescription lenses with our step-by-step configurator. Choose materials, treatments, and upload your prescription.
column2: Configure your prescription lenses with our step-by-step configurator. Choose materials, treatments, and upload your prescription.

column1: Or add frame only to cart using the button below
column2: Or add frame only to cart using the button below

column1: Sphere (SPH): Lens power needed to correct nearsightedness or farsightedness. Range: -20.00 to +20.00.
column2: Sphere (SPH): Lens power needed to correct short-sightedness or long-sightedness. Range: -20.00 to +20.00.

column1: Cylinder (CYL): Lens power for astigmatism correction. Range: -8.00 to +8.00. Leave empty if no astigmatism.
column2: Cylinder (CYL): Lens power for astigmatism correction. Range: -8.00 to +8.00. Leave empty if no astigmatism.

column1: Axis: Angle of astigmatism correction (0-180°). Required only if CYL is present.
column2: Axis: Angle of astigmatism correction (0-180°). Required only if CYL is present.

column1: Addition (ADD): Additional magnifying power for reading (0.25 to 4.00). Required for bifocal/progressive lenses.
column2: Addition (ADD): Additional magnifying power for reading (0.25 to 4.00). Required for bifocal/progressive lenses.

column1: Prism: Corrects eye alignment issues (0.00 to 10.00). Usually prescribed for double vision.
column2: Prism: Corrects eye alignment issues (0.00 to 10.00). Usually prescribed for double vision.

column1: Prism Base: Direction of prism correction (UP/DOWN/IN/OUT). Required if prism value is present.
column2: Prism Base: Direction of prism correction (UP/DOWN/IN/OUT). Required if prism value is present.

column1: Pupillary Distance (PD): Distance between pupils (20-80mm). Critical for proper lens centering.
column2: Pupillary Distance (PD): Distance between pupils (20-80mm). Critical for proper lens centring.

column1: Axis is required when Cylinder is present.
column2: Axis is required when Cylinder is present.

column1: Prism Base is required when Prism is present.
column2: Prism Base is required when Prism is present.

column1: Addition is required for progressive/bifocal lenses.
column2: Addition is required for progressive/bifocal lenses.

column1: Añadir solo la montura al carrito
Cristales para corregir la visión de lejos (miopía) o de cerca (hipermetropía)
column2: Lenses to correct distance vision (myopia) or near vision (hypermetropia)

column1: Cristales para corregir la visión de lejos y de cerca, también llamadas progresivas
column2: Lenses to correct distance and near vision, also called progressive

column1: Cristales sin graduar, para usar como accesorio de moda
column2: Non-prescription lenses for use as a fashion accessory

column1: Selecciona el tipo de visión progresiva
column2: Select the type of progressive vision

column1: Campo de visión estándar. Ideal para uso general diario
column2: Standard field of vision. Ideal for general daily use

column1: Campo de visión ampliado. Mayor comodidad en visión lateral
column2: Extended field of vision. Greater comfort in peripheral vision

column1: Campo de visión máximo. La mejor experiencia visual disponible
column2: Maximum field of vision. The best visual experience available

column1: ¿Cómo se lee la graduación de mis gafas?
column2: How do I read my glasses prescription?

column1: Funcionalidad próximamente disponible. Podrá subir su receta óptica en formato JPG, PNG o PDF.
column2: Functionality coming soon. You will be able to upload your optical prescription in JPG, PNG or PDF format.

column1: Seleccione el tipo de cristal que mejor se adapte a sus necesidades
column2: Select the lens type that best suits your needs

column1: Cristales estándar sin tratamiento adicional. Perfectos para uso diario en interiores.
column2: Standard lenses without additional treatment. Perfect for daily indoor use.

column1: Filtro luz azul para pantallas. Reduce fatiga ocular por ordenadores y móviles.
column2: Blue light filter for screens. Reduces eye fatigue from computers and mobiles.

column1: Variedad de opciones con color en el cristal. Desde básicos hasta polarizados.
column2: Variety of coloured lens options. From basic to polarised.

column1: Se oscurecen automáticamente con luz solar. Gafas y gafas de sol en uno.
column2: Darken automatically in sunlight. Glasses and sunglasses in one.

column1: Teñido uniforme en toda la lente con colores clásicos
column2: Uniform tint throughout the lens in classic colours

column1: Tintado con un degradado más oscuro en la parte superior de la lente y más claro en la inferior
column2: Tinted with a darker gradient at the top of the lens and lighter at the bottom

column1: Tintado con efecto espejo en diferentes colores, que evitan que se vean los ojos
column2: Tinted with mirror effect in different colours, preventing the eyes from being seen

column1: Tintado en colores clásicos pero con un filtro adicional que reduce los reflejos y la niebla
column2: Tinted in classic colours but with an additional filter that reduces reflections and haze

column1: Los polarizados comparten la selección de índice con los transparentes
column2: Polarised lenses share the index selection with clear lenses

column1: Seleccione la marca de sus cristales
Cristales de alta calidad fabricados con los mejores estándares. Excelente relación calidad-precio.
column2: High-quality lenses manufactured to the best standards. Excellent value for money.

column1: Líder mundial en lentes oftálmicas. Tecnología avanzada y máxima calidad óptica.
column2: World leader in ophthalmic lenses. Advanced technology and maximum optical quality.

column1: Precisión alemana en óptica. Reconocida mundialmente por su innovación y excelencia.
column2: German precision in optics. Recognised worldwide for innovation and excellence.

column1: Visión nítida en todas las condiciones
El índice determina el grosor del cristal. Mayor índice = cristal más fino.
column2: The index determines lens thickness. Higher index = thinner lens.

column1: Grosor estándar. Recomendado para graduaciones bajas (hasta ±2.00).
column2: Standard thickness. Recommended for low prescriptions (up to ±2.00).

column1: 20% más fino. Recomendado para graduaciones medias (±2.00 a ±4.00).
column2: 20% thinner. Recommended for medium prescriptions (±2.00 to ±4.00).

column1: High index lens (1.67 or 1.74) recommended for strong prescriptions
column2: High index lens (1.67 or 1.74) recommended for strong prescriptions

column1: Progressive lenses work better with polycarbonate or high-index materials
column2: Progressive lenses work better with polycarbonate or high-index materials
